explanation: The loop header was the problem: for i in range(20): only iterates i = 0..19, so the code checks multiples of 5 up to 95 but never considers 100. If N is 100 (or another value where 100 is the nearest multiple), the result will be wrong. I fixed that single line to iterate up to 20 (i = 0..20) by using range(21), so multiples 0..100 are considered.
fixed_code:
N=int(input())
list=[]
for i in range(21):
  list.append(abs(N-i*5))
In=list.index(min(list))
print(In*5)
